history.18th-19thCenturies: Spain established colony in 1778 via Treaty of El Pardo. British base on Bioko (1827–1843). Spanish rule restored in 1844 as 'Territorios Españoles del Golfo de Guinea'.
history.20thCentury: Treaty of Paris in 1900 defined territorial boundaries. Spanish Guinea became a union of colonies in 1926, a Spanish colony in 1956, and a province in 1958 until independence in 1968.
history.agriculturalEconomy: Large cacao plantations developed on Fernando Po. Labor shortages led to the importation of workers from Liberia, Nigeria, and Cameroon.
history.decolonisation: After WWII, Spanish Guinea moved towards decolonisation. Independence granted as Republic of Equatorial Guinea on 12 October 1968.
